Administration Officer - Maternity Leave replacement

Company Name Ridley Corporation Ltd Company Location Lara, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 68 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Details
  • Leading Agribusiness based in Lara
  • Maximum term contract, full time position based in Lara

Who we are?
Ridley AgriProducts is Australia's largest manufacturer of stockfeed and supplements. It provides a critical service for both the majority of livestock food producers in the beef, dairy, poultry, pig, sheep and aquaculture industries, equine and canines in the recreational sector.

What's on offer?

This vacancy arises to cover for maternity leave. We are seeking a well-organized, self-starter with strong computer skills to fulfill administration duties at the Lara manufacturing site.

The role is for a maximum term of 13 months. We are prepared to consider a range of different working hours if requested by applicants. For interested employees, this role may lead to opportunities in different roles within the large Ridley organization.

Reporting to the Site Manager and supported by the Regional Administration Manager, the key purpose of this role is to ensure all inventories are accurate and robust within the ERP live systems on site including daily and monthly stock reconciliations and all inward goods are correctly maintained, booked and entered for the site.

The Key Responsibilities For This Position Include
  • Answer telephone calls from internal and external customers as per established procedure.
  • Ensure site visitors are attended to promptly and correct procedures are followed.
  • Ensure that the daily administration processing procedures are followed per national timeframes and guidelines.
  • Enter all customer sales orders into ERP system accurately and promptly per national guidelines and complete checking as required.
  • Co-ordinate month-end processing to ensure all month transactions are captured.
  • Daily completion of all inward and outward mail.
  • Accurate completion of weighbridge transactions per current guidelines.


To Be Considered For The Role You Will Have
  • A sound knowledge of general accounting and administration functions
  • High level operator of computer systems including ERP and Microsoft Office systems.
  • Strong verbal, negotiation and written communication skills.
  • Ability to relate to all levels of management.
  • High attention to detail, and time management
  • Knowledge and an understanding of company policies and procedures in relation to administration.
  • Key duties of Inventory Officer Sales
  • Inventory Management principles and knowledge desirable.

In return for your skills and commitment, Ridley offers great benefits, warm culture and supportive team. If this is you, please click 'apply now' and provide both your resume and cover letter. Shortlisted candidates will be required to undertake online psychometric testing and a comprehensive pre-employment medical (including drug and alcohol testing). Open to applicants with unrestricted work rights in Australia. Previous applicants need not apply.

Job description

Job Summary

As an Account Manager in NetApp's Telstra Account Team you are responsible for developing and maintaining positive on-going relationships to support Telstra’s evolving business needs by positioning and selling NetApp's Products and Professional Services across multiple business units within the Telstra business.

Your focus areas will be in prospecting, developing opportunities, responding to RFP's and developing proposals to Telstra on NetApp’s industry leading Products and Services. Cross-functional teams from NetApp's Marketing, Systems Engineering and Product Development functions provide support and tools for you to leverage to attain and exceed sales performance goals. You will utilize your excellent relationship building, negotiating and technical skills to be successful in this role.


Essential Functions
The essential responsibilities of the Account Manager are to work directly with Telstra to identify and develop sales opportunities and to work effectively across functions with other NetApp employees.
Specific areas of responsibility that you will be responsible for include:


  • Use relationship management techniques to develop selling opportunities within Telstra; penetrate new divisions and develop new selling relationships
  • Schedule and attend sales appointments with Telstra. Other NetApp sales team members may also participate in the sales call to help qualify the opportunity.\xa0
  • Determining if Telstra has a valid need for NetApp products and services.
  • Proposing an evaluation test project to enable Telstra to test the product or products in their own environment.
  • Determining acceptance criteria that Telstra could use to determine the success of an evaluation test project
  • Utilizing a consultative approach, discuss business issues with Telstra and develop a formal quote, a written sales proposal, or a formal sales presentation addressing their business needs.
  • Respond to RFP's and follow up with Telstra.
  • Develop an account management plan to sell to Telstra based on their business need.
  • Build and strengthen your business relationship with Telstra to ensure that their needs are being met.\xa0
  • \xa0Recommend marketing strategies.
  • Provide status information to your Manager including forecast/pipeline information.\xa0
  • Provide, or facilitate training opportunities for your account.
  • Identify NetApp customer references that can be utilized when reference selling.

\xa0

Requirements

  • Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with employees within department and across functions.
  • Aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems.\xa0
  • Ability to convey information clearly and provide analysis as needed to help customer make buying decisions.\xa0



Responsibility & Interactions

Responsibility:\xa0

  • As a seasoned professional with a wide range of experiences, this individual uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
  • Is responsible for a specific geographical install base and large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts.


Interaction:\xa0

  • This individual effectively works with, and influences senior internal personnel within the function, employees in other functions that support the sales effort, and has direct customer contact.\xa0
  • Limited management supervision and direction is provided since this individual operates and drives results independently.
  • The ideal candidate is a subject matter expert and strongly influences sales team decisions and initiatives. May also act as a team leader and major decision maker for team projects.

\xa0

Education and Experiences

  • 8 to 12 years of overall experience is preferred.
  • \xa0A Bachelor of Arts or Sciences Degree in Electrical Engineer or Computer Science; or related field is required. A Graduate Degree is desired.
  • Experience which demonstrates a significant level of expertise in technical specifications\xa0
  • required to sell NetApp products and services is required.

Early Years Registration Officer

Company Name Moonee Valley City Council Company Location Moonee Valley, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 155 views

Job description

Early Years Registration Officer

Reference number: 12498

Closing date: 11:45pm, Sunday 16 September 2018
  • 2 x Permanent Part-Time Positions
  • 0.8 FTE (30.4 hours) and 0.6 FTE (22.8 hours)
  • $32.60 - $35.20 per hour + superannuation
  • Supportive team environment

Moonee Valley City Council are currently seeking a motivated and enthusiastic individual to join the Planning, Policy and Advocacy business unit, within the Family & Children’s Department as an Early Years Registration Officer.

Family and Children’s Services brings together a range of services that focus on optimising learning, development, health and family wellbeing outcomes for children and young people from 0-17 years. The Planning, Policy and Advocacy Unit is responsible for pedagogical leadership, advocacy, policy advice and strategic service system planning within the Family and Children’s Services Department as well as operational functions.

Within this position, you will actively contribute to the success of the Family & Children’s Department through effective coordination and administration of the Central Registration Service for registering children into Council’s early years program in accordance with relevant policies and procedures.

Some Responsibilities Include
  • Provide timely and accurate processing of central registrations, placement allocations, waiting lists and correspondence to families and participating early years services, both Council and Non Council.
  • Prepare and consult with Team Leader, Council’s Communications and Customer Services regarding relevant information in relation to early year’s registrations and service documentation.
  • In consultation with Information Services (IS) and software provider, monitor and update the Central Registration System (CRS) computer program on a regular basis

To be successful within this position, you will hold a certificate III in Business Administration and / or have demonstrated relevant experience in office administration. In addition to this, you will have demonstrated experience in providing a high level of customer service to stakeholders.

Application Requirements

Applications must be submitted through our online system https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/ and include a separate cover letter, resume, copy of relevant qualifications and address the Selection Criteria to be considered for this position. Please also identify which part-time position you would be interested (0.8 FTE or 0.6 FTE). Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.

Detailed information on how to apply and application requirements is available in the Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement on our website.

For further information please view the Position Description or contact Shelly O’Brien on (03) 9243 1120.

Moonee Valley City Council is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability.

Moonee Valley City Council is committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a supportive, effective workplace and positive, barrier-free recruitment process. If you are applying for a role and have support or access requirements, we encourage you to let us know through your application or to the hiring manager. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you. Your personal information will be kept confidential in compliance with the Privacy Act. If you would like to talk to us about accessibility or reasonable adjustment, please email hradmin@mvcc.vic.gov.au or call 9243 1122.

Job description

Summary

Highly rewarding LA role assisting our clients and the friendly Geelong team. Develop your knowledge and skills in our Personal Injuries practice.

Overview

The Firm
Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.

The Role
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our Personal Injuries team as a Legal Assistant. Based in our Geelong office, you will use your established skill set that you have developed from your previous experience as a Legal Assistant to support our busy team in an administrative capacity on a full time permanent basis.

Key Responsibilities
  • Answer all incoming enquiries and assist or transfer calls where appropriate
  • Provide accurate information to clients within a timely manner
  • Follow operator instructions to arrange opening and closing of files
  • Draft basic correspondence for clients
  • Arrange and manage appointments
  • Various administration tasks, including sorting mail, preparing bills and producing file notes


Skills & Experience We’re Looking For
  • Solid experience in a similar role with exposure to litigation
  • Experience in a Personal Injuries practice desirable
  • A strong understanding of court processes
  • Excellent organisation and time management skills
  • Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
  • Proficiency in Microsoft suite


A Law Firm Like No Other.

Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost a century.

We also offer great employee benefits, some of which include:
  • Ongoing coaching and career development
  • Fully paid gym membership
  • Salary Continuance & Life Insurance
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Wellbeing Programs for you and your family
  • Generous leave entitlements
  • Health and Wellbeing Leave


How To Apply

Case Manager

Company Name EML (Employers Mutual Limited) Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organisation that specialises in Workers Compensation. Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?


  • Melbourne Office
  • Manage a portfolio of claims
  • Excellent opportunity for career progression and growth


Established in 1910, EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company with offices throughout Australia. Managing workers compensation claims across different industries, we are a dynamic company who has grown from 50 to 1,500 staff in the last 10 years. With this rapid growth means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate. For over 100 years, the people of Australia have put their trust in EML for their workers compensation needs.


THE OPPORTUNITY


You will play a critical role in pro-actively and effectively managing a portfolio of claims and helping people get their lives back after injury or illness.

This position requires a focus on providing excellent customer service and proactive strategic direction of injured workers current and future requirements. It operates within a deadline-driven team environment, relying on pro-active, timely and effective management of a portfolio of claims.

The primary focus of this position is to enhance injury and claims management outcomes and the safe and sustainable return to work of injured workers. In this role, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:


  • Adopt a service- orientated approach that is focused on early intervention and the interests of workers and employers
  • Ensure that active and timely intervention occurs to improve recovery and return to work outcomes
  • Provide workers compensation advice to stakeholders such as workers, employers and providers
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders
  • Assist the worker and employer with the claim process and providing support in the completion of relevant documents to ensure timely access to required services to support return to work and injury recovery
  • Pro-actively proceed with appropriate case management to achieve the optimum outcome of early sustainable return to work for workers with reasonable claim costs


ABOUT YOU


We're looking for people with a passion to make a positive difference and help people get their lives back.

To be successful in this role, you'll have proven skills and experience, including:


  • Customer Service and/or Office experience
  • High attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Effective communication and conflict resolution skills
  • Negotiation and influencing
  • Empathy and understanding
  • Provide excellent customer service and build strong collaborative relationships with our customers
  • Ability to earn trust in relationships with others by consistently demonstrating integrity and professional competence
  • Effectively listen and understand the needs of the customer and what is important to them to enable their recovery and return to work
  • Competent in the use of MS Word and MS Excel
  • Basic understanding of medical terminology
